data.text: @EricTopol The NEJM correspondence has a shocking lack of context. By not mentioning that multiple other neutralizing MCAs had also demonstrated even higher levels of therapy emergent resistance, the authors imply that therapy emergent resistance is a new phenomenon unique to Sotrovimab.

@EricTopol Are there similar studies for other mAbs? This particular one was known to be generally less potent than others against other variants. Even though it remained active against BA1, it may still be too weak.

@MichaelTeng88 @EricTopol You mean against BA1 or BA2 or both?
Im trying to convince a colleague to get it, but can’t find reliable info against BA1.
@EricTopol Interesting that Evusheld (COV2-2196/COV2-2130) still seems to be pretty good, as least in vitro.

@nlosrgr8 @EricTopol Indeed.  Basically, the algorithm is:

The virus infects humans.
Humans develop treatment.
The virus evolves to defeat that treatment.

Rinse and Repeat.
Pandemic ends when 3) stops happening.
@pphilp @EricTopol Well, used to that news, aren’t we
